comment: Professor Amie was unlike any professor I have had thus far. She's extremely goofy and bright and encourages student activity through games and discussions. The work can be pretty tough and not always clear, but she is always available for questions. Work hard and you will find the class easy + enjoyable.

Despite the course being homework heavy, Amie did her best at making this class as enjoyable as possible! She's very hard on due dates, but is understanding and flexible!  She also requires in-class participation! Additionally, she tries to implement creative extra credit assignments like going to a haunted house, the Acworth Festival, etc.

Take her if you want an easy A!!!!!!! Interesting teacher, but does anything to help you get an a if the class is good to her.  She will help you out the most she can and she is not a tough grader. Must go to class every week, as the assignments are based on the lectures.

i LOVE prof Amie. She is the sweetest and wants everyone to get an A. She offers a ton of extra credit after midterms and lets you redo a paper. I learn so much from her lectures and i've become such a better writer. There's 4 major papers and a few other short assignments. She also is constantly helping students to network. TAKE HER!!!!.

TAKE HER!! I suck at English but as long as you put in effort she will give you a good grade. She offers extra credit & accepts late work. She is very understanding & loves all her students. She assigns 3 major essays which aren't hard, a weekly report task every week, an exit ticket, & a few videos to watch and respond to. Easy work & easy A!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: The best class to get a laugh from this semester! So fun and enjoyable! She will be there for you as long as you show up and put in the effort!

Professor Flanagan is such a caring professor. She was one of my favorite teachers this semester. In this course we wrote 4 "big papers". She gives you amazing feedback on how to improve you paper and you can always ask her for help if needed.She offers extra credit and gives plenty of feedback.

Professor Flanagan class is fairly easy if you pay attention. She is incredibly flexible and understanding. Throughout the entire semester we only completed four major assignments and if you do not receive a decent grade she allows you to redo it as well as offer the class extra credit assignments.
Professor Flanagan is such a caring professor. Gives time to students if they need help and talks to you if you are struggling. Offers extra credit and gives plenty of feedback.
She's relaxed and flexible. She changes requirements a lot, so you need to attend class to hear about it because she won't post about it. Attend class, participate, do your work, and it'll be easy.

This class is easy if you attend every class, pay attention, and do your work. She gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. Start the assignments early and plan ahead for them. She likes to change requirements a lot and not go off the rubric. It can be stressful, but if you communicate and ask questions you'll be fine. She tries to make it fun

Mrs. Flanagan has very clear and specific criteria that give students a fair and easy chance to learn and inhance their writing. Her class has so much personality and I personally looked forward to it every time.
If you're more of an introvert then this class probably isn't for you but if you're not then you would probably have a lot of fun.
Professor Flanagan was a joy. She was funny, smiling, and helpful. I would recommend her to anyone needing to take an English course.

A majority of this class is irrelevant repeated lectures that have absolutely no substance and won't help you with the assignments you will have for a grade. You have to check D2L everyday for assignments because you will hear nothing about them in class or learn anything related to them but since attendance is required you have to sit through it.
Amazing teacher! Highly recommend. If you hate English she makes it easy and fun!

Prof Flanagan is a good educator. An avg week includes five hw assignments. She pays attention to how students react to things she says and takes this into account when assigning work. If you complain about the work load she will increase it. She is very nice and helpful if you show that you care. Will bump grades if you show improvement.

She is honestly such a joy! If you ever need help or you're confused, all you have to do is reach out to her during office hours. She will help you as long as you show up to class, do the work and go to her if you need help. Don't make this class harder than it has to be. She's very understanding and she won't fail you if she knows you're trying!

She made us print all of our essays and assignments and then would put grades as zeros and did not know where the assignments were. At the end of the semester I had to spend $20 printing assignments that I had already turned in. She ended up bumping my grade to an A because I "showed improvement" but the amount of stress she caused was not worth it

Mrs. Flanagan was the best English professor I've ever had. She makes all of her assignments personal and fun so it's not boring to complete. Her class is very informative and is very helpful with completing the assignments. She answers any email and will help you with ANY problem you have regarding her class. She was a wonderful teacher!

This feedback if for ENGLISH 1102. She's an amazing professor with laid-back lectures and fun assignments. She answers any questions you have about your assignments and gives great feedback on how your paper could be better. Be prepared for laughs and fun times!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: She is very caring about her students.

Part of the grade for the class is attendance but class is very enjoyable. It is mostly seminar and games based like we learn something then play a game on it. She keeps the information interesting. Lots of weekly papers and lots to read. I loved Flanagan as a professor and person. Keep in contact with her after her class is over.

Professor Flanagan was definitely an unexpected experience. Her class honestly isn't hard at all if you just keep up with the work, and she's actually pretty lenient if you talk to her about your assignments. She's very spontaneous and engaging, you honestly never know what to expect in her class, but once you get used to that its a lot of fun.
I love professor flannagan she is so funny and sweet. She makes the lectures  super entraining
Goat

Let me break it down. 1. She is nice 2. She is funny 3. There's not much class work during class 4. You get a lot of homework, but it makes up for #3 6. If you have 30-40min anytime during the week, you can do all the work. 7. This is a perfect class, it balanced work wise. 5. Thank you Prof. I'm glad I could make a Smash Bros video for a grade (:

Prof Flanagan is a great teacher. She is funny and caring. Go to class and do your homework, and you will pass. She is willing to work with you, and although some of the assignments take a while, it isn't too tricky. I want to emphasize again what a wonderful person she is and an excellent teacher. Take this class.
Extensive homework every class and multiple papers a week including major papers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: One of my favorite professor so far going through college. She is very kind and helpful to all her students and will help guide you through the entire course literally. Show up to class, Participate, get a passing grade!

She is genuinely one of the worst teachers I have ever had. If you miss one class you will be lost for the rest of the semester, and she never responds back to emails. She also does not take any late work, even though she does not grade any assignments. She gives 5 assignments a week which is just not realistic when students have other classes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: This professor is one of the best professors there probably is . She gives out 5 assignments a week but they are like 10-15 minute assignments each which will take you no more than 2 hours to do. She also provides a lot of extra credit and late assignments turn in for 80%!! Would definitely choose this profesor again if she taught 1102

Professor Flanagan is an ok professor, she does give lots of work and most of it is 5 assignments weekly plus projects. If you are not in class then you miss out on about two grades. She says it is an easy class to pass but not with the workload she gives you. You also have to participate a lot or you lose points towards your grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters
